intro: Papaver dubium var. minus, commonly known as the lesser poppy, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe. It features striking, bright yellow to orange-red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers consist of a single, showy corolla with a central stigma and stamens, typical of the Papaveraceae family. This species is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and meadows.
